backup.sort.description: Sorting of the backups to be returned on each page.
backup.sort.name: sort

database.sort.description: Sorting of the databases to be returned on each page.
database.sort.name: sort

flavor.description: The id of an instance flavor.
flavor.name: flavorId

flavor.sort.description: Sorting of the flavors to be returned on each page.
flavor.sort.name: sort

instance.sort.description: Sorting of the items to be returned on each page.
instance.sort.name: sort

page.description: Number of the page of items list to be returned.
page.name: page

region.description: The region which should be addressed
region.name: region

size.description: Number of items to be returned on each page.
size.name: size

user.sort.description: Sorting of the users to be returned on each page.
user.sort.name: sort

code.description: The http error code of the error.

message.description: More detailed information about the error.

traceId.description: The trace id of the request.

type.description: Describes in which state the api was when the error happened.

collations.description: List of collations available for the instance.

flavors.description: List of flavors available for the project.

versions.description: A list containing available sqlserver versions.

backups.description: The list containing the information about the backups.
List of the backups beloning to that database

databaseName.description: Name of the database the backups belong to

compatibilities.description: List of compatibilities available for a d

runningRestores.description: List of the currently running Restore jobs

databases.description: A list containing all databases for the instance.

ListFlavors.description: The flavor of the instance containing the technical features.

instances.description: List of owned instances and their current status.

roles.description: List of roles available for an instance.

users.description: List of all users inside an instance

code.description: the http error should be always 422 for validationError

validation.description: errors for all fields where the error happened

backup.completionTime.description: The time when the backup was completed in RFC3339 format.

backup.restoreTime.description: the time for the restore it will be calculated between first backup and last backup

backup.retainedUntil.description: The time until the backup will be retained.

database_name.description: the name of the database that is being restored

estimated_completion_time.description: the projected time when the restore should be completed

percent_complete.description: the percentage of the current running restore job

start_time.description: the start time of the current running restore job

backup.schedule.description: The schedule for on what time and how often the database backup will be created. The schedule is written as a cron schedule.

backup.schedule.opt.description: The schedule for on what time and how often the database backup will be created. The schedule is written as a cron schedule.

backup.size.description: The size of the backup in bytes.

backup.type.description: The type of the backup, which can be automated or manual triggered.

network.description: the network configuration of the instance.

roles.description: A list containing the user roles for the instance. A list with the valid user roles can be retrieved using the List Roles endpoint.

database.collation.description: The collation of the database. This database collation should match the *collation_name* of one of the collations given by the **Get database collation list** endpoint.

database.created.description: The date when the database was created in RFC3339 format.

database.roles.description: The name and the roles for a database for a user.

roles.description: The name and the roles for a database

s3_files.description: The backup files from which the database should be restored

flavor.cpu.description: The cpu count of the instance.

flavor.flavorId.description: The id of the instance flavor.

flavor.flavorId.opt.description: The id of the instance flavor.

flavor.maxGB.description: maximum storage which can be ordered for the flavor in Gigabyte.

flavor.memory.description: The memory of the instance in Gibibyte.

flavor.minGB.description: minimum storage which is required to order in Gigabyte.

flavor.nodeType.description: defines the nodeType it can be either single or HA

flavor.storageClasses.description: maximum storage which can be ordered for the flavor in Gigabyte.

flavor.storageClasses.storageClass.description: a storageClass defines how efficient the storage can work

flavor.storageRange.description: range of maximum and minimum storage which can be ordered for the flavor in Gigabyte.

instance.edition.description: Edition of the MSSQL server instance

instance.encryption.description: this defines which key to use for storage encryption

instance.isDeletable.description: Whether the instance can be deleted or not.

instance.network.description: The access configuration of the instance

instance.network.accessScope.description:
The network access scope of the instance

⚠️ **Note:** This feature is in private preview. Supplying this object is only permitted for enabled accounts. If your account does not have access, the request will be rejected.

instance.retentionDays.description: The days for how long the backup files should be stored before cleaned up. 30 to 365

instance.version.description: The sqlserver version used for the instance.

replicas.description: How many replicas the instance should have.

replicas.opt.description: How many replicas the instance should have.

database_name.description: The name of the database on the instance to be restore.

file_number.description: The sequence number of the file

file_path.description: The path to the file on the S3 bucket

source.backup.description: Restore from an existing managed backup.

source.externalS3.description: Restore from an external S3 backup file.

logging_guid.description: Logging guid to have a complete activity log over all sub stored procedures.

storage.description: The object containing information about the storage size and class.

storage.class.description: The storage class for the storage.

storage.create.description: The object containing information about the storage size and class.

storage.update.description: The object containing information about the storage size and class.

network.description: the network configuration of the instance.
the network configuration of the instance.

user.database.description: The default database for a user of the instance.

user.host.description: The host of the instance in which the user belongs to.

user.port.description: The port of the instance in which the user belongs to.

user.role.description: The user role for the instance.

user.status.description: The current status of the user.

user.uri.description: The connection string for the user to the instance.

version.description: The version of the sqlserver instance and more details.

beta.description: Flag if the version is a beta version. If set the version may contain bugs and is not fully tested.

deprecated.description: Timestamp in RFC3339 format which says when the version will no longer be supported by STACKIT.

recommend.description: Flag if the version is recommend by the STACKIT Team.

version.description: The sqlserver version used for the instance.

info.description: This is the documentation for the STACKIT MSSQL service

patch.description:
Update an available instance of a mssql database. No fields are required.

**Please note that any changes applied via PUT or PATCH requests will initiate a reboot of the SQL Server Flex Instance.**
